John Arrowwood wrote:

>A thought:  To avoid overfitting, you should probably have at least a few 
>random vectors during each generational evaluation, too.
>
>  
>
Fair point. But to be effective the number of random test cases should 
probably be significant in proportion to the fixed cases. If overfitting 
does occur it might be better to keep the fixed set of vectors I 
described (or some similar set) and to 'wiggle' the vectors slightly 
between each evaluation.

Colin.
